title: Piers Morgan makes rude joke about Spice Girls’ Geri Horner and Mel B
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Piers Morgan turned the air blue on Good Morning Britain earlier with a very rude joke about Spice Girls stars Geri Horner and Mel B.

The 54-year-old host was discussing the reports that the Spice Girls have called off their Australian tour due to an alleged rift between Geri and Mel.

GMB’s entertainment correspondent Richard Arnold claimed on Tuesday’s episode: ‘They were going to go down under or at least Mel B spouted it out on-stage.’

Piers couldn’t help but make a quip about Geri and Mel’s romantic encounter, joking: ‘I think it may have been because they’d been down under that’s the problem.’

Richard chimed in: ‘I think it’s because of the feud that we ignited or on this very show or at least on your Life Stories.’

It was in reference to Mel B’s revelation on his Life Stories With Piers Morgan show, that she and Geri slept together in the ‘90s.

Although previous reports claimed there was initially tension between the popstars, they were the best of friends on the Spice Girls’ epic stadium tour this summer.

Piers turned the air blue this morning (Picture: ITV, Good Morning Britain)

Geri and Mel seemed to get on well on the Spice Girls tour this summer (Picture: Getty Images)

But that didn’t stop Piers from insisting all is not well between the singers.

‘I’m told it was a real problem,’ he alleged.

‘They got through it with gritted teeth but I’m told the simmering problem with Mel and Geri because of that revelation has been very difficult for the rest of the tour plans. And they had all these other plans which I’m told is not happening.’

He added: ‘Geri’s seething basically.’

A source told The Sun that Mel and Geri ‘clashed’ and were ‘arguing’ behind-the-scenes, so decided not to go out on the road again.

The Spice Girls’ stadium tour was a huge success with multiple sold-out shows around the UK, including an epic stint at London’s Wembley Arena.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.
